nodes.title: Article S11
nodes.summary: This partial document covers the procedures for amending the statutes and for the dissolution of a sports association or club. It specifies that amendments can be proposed by the board or requested by two-thirds of the athletes or paying members, and require a two-thirds majority vote in the general assembly. For dissolution, a two-thirds majority vote is also required, but it only becomes effective after approval by the federation, followed by the establishment of a liquidation committee to decide on the allocation of the association's assets.

nodes.title: Article S2
nodes.summary:
This partial document contains articles from the statute (statuts types) of a non-profit sports association in French. The main points covered are:

1.  The legal foundation, registration, and approval of the association (Articles 1 and 2).
2.  The governing rules for the association's existence and operation, including a prohibition on formation based on tribe, race, religion, or political affiliation, and its unlimited duration (Article 3).
3.  The association's purpose (moral, physical, and civic training of youth and members) and its means of action (Article 4).
4.  The two categories of sports associations: unidisciplinary and pluridisciplinary (Article 5).
5.  The composition of the association: membership requirements, annual fees, admission rights, and the honorary member title (Article 6).
6.  The conditions under which membership is lost: resignation or expulsion for non-payment of dues or serious reasons (Article 7).

nodes.title: Article S4
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the requirements for a sports association or club to be officially affiliated with its governing sports federation. The main points covered are the conditions for admission, which include: presenting official statutes and internal regulations; having a competent and reliable committee; committing to follow all federation and sub-entity rules; ensuring at least three-quarters of its members are Congolese nationals; obtaining mandatory sports insurance for all athletes and officials at the start of each season; and agreeing to submit to any disciplinary sanctions imposed by the federation.

nodes.title: Article S6
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the governance structure of a sports association or club, focusing on its two main organs: the General Assembly and the Management Committee. It details the composition, responsibilities, and operational rules for each organ, including eligibility for membership, meeting procedures, and the specific roles and election processes for committee members.

nodes.title: Article S7
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the roles and responsibilities of key officers within a sports association or club (President, Vice-President, Secretary, Deputy Secretary, Treasurer, and Advisors), as well as the structure and governance of the club's disciplinary sections. It specifies how authority is delegated in cases of absence, defines official correspondence duties, and establishes that the sections' internal regulations must be approved by the General Assembly and comply with prevailing sports statutes.

nodes.title: Article S9
nodes.summary: The partial document outlines the financial resources of a sports association or club, listing membership fees, event revenues, subsidies, and exceptional/sponsorship funds. It also details the oversight obligations of a parent entity, requiring affiliated clubs to submit annual reports on financial usage and administrative/sporting management.
